metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6664 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
mysqld_safe in Oracle MySQL through 5.5.51, 5.6.x through 5.6.32, and 5.7.xthrough 5.7.14; MariaDB; Percona Server before 5.5.51-38.2, 5.6.x before5.6.32-78-1, and 5.7.x before 5.7.14-8; and Percona XtraDB Cluster before5.5.41-37.0, 5.6.x before 5.6.32-25.17, and 5.7.x before 5.7.14-26.17, whenusing file-based logging, allows local users with access to the mysqlaccount to gain root privileges via a symlink attack on error logs andpossibly other files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6664` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadbd18 - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-client - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-client-10.0 - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-client-core-10.0 - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-common - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-plugin-connect - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-plugin-spider - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-plugin-tokudb - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-server - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-server-10.0 - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-server-core-10.0 - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-test - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mariadb-test-data - 10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.0.29-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
mysql-5.7 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.15-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
